entry.title: Developmental convergence and divergence in human stem cell models of autism (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Developmental convergence and divergence in human stem cell models of autism

Risk associated with genetically defined forms of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) can propagate by means of transcriptional regulation to affect convergently dysregulated pathways, providing insight into the convergent impact of ASD genetic risk on human neurodevelopment.

  • Aaron Gordon
  • Se-Jin Yoon
  • Daniel H. Geschwind
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2026

entry.title: Projected impacts of climate change on malaria in Africa (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Projected impacts of climate change on malaria in Africa

Projected impacts of climate change on malaria burden in Africa by 2050 highlight the urgent need for climate-resilient malaria control strategies and robust emergency response systems to safeguard progress towards malaria eradication.

  • Tasmin L. Symons
  • Alexander Moran
  • Peter W. Gething
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Constraints on axion dark matter by distributed intercity quantum sensors (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Constraints on axion dark matter by distributed intercity quantum sensors

Amplification and optimal noise filtering in hyperpolarized noble-gas spins of observations from distributed intercity quantum sensors monitoring for unexpected transient rotations of polarized spins set parameter range constraints in the search for axion dark matter.

  • Yuanhong Wang
  • Ying Huang
  • Jiangfeng Du
Article28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Prethermalization by random multipolar driving on a 78-qubit processor (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Prethermalization by random multipolar driving on a 78-qubit processor

The existence of a long-lived, prethermal regime in many-body systems with tunable heating rates, driven by structured random protocols, is observed using a 78-qubit superconducting quantum processor.

  • Zheng-He Liu
  • Yu Liu
  • Heng Fan
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Multimodal learning with next-token prediction for large multimodal models (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Multimodal learning with next-token prediction for large multimodal models

Emu3 enables large-scale text, image and video learning based solely on next-token prediction, matching the generation and perception performance of task-specific methods, with implications for the development of scalable and unified multimodal intelligence systems.

  • Xinlong Wang
  • Yufeng Cui
  • Tiejun Huang
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Radiation-tolerant atomic-layer-scale RF system for spaceborne communication (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Radiation-tolerant atomic-layer-scale RF system for spaceborne communication

Using a wafer-scale monolayer 2D MoS2 process instead of conventional silicon-based devices to manufacture components of spaceborne communication systems demonstrates radiation tolerance, low bit error rate and long-term stability, even under much harsher radiation environments.

  • Liyuan Zhu
  • Yang Yang
  • Peng Zhou
Article28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Accurate determination of the 3D atomic structure of amorphous materials (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Accurate determination of the 3D atomic structure of amorphous materials

A quantitative framework for atomic electron tomography enables reliable determination of three-dimensional (3D) atomic coordinates and elemental identities in amorphous materials.

  • Yuxuan Liao
  • Haozhi Sha
  • Jianwei Miao
Analysis28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Intestinal macrophages modulate synucleinopathy along the gut–brain axis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Intestinal macrophages modulate synucleinopathy along the gut–brain axis

Muscularis macrophages, housekeepers of enteric nervous system integrity and intestinal homeostasis, modulate α-synuclein pathology and neurodegeneration in models of Parkinson’s disease, and understanding the accompanying mechanisms could pave the way for early-stage biomarkers.

  • Sebastiaan De Schepper
  • Viktoras Konstantellos
  • Tim Bartels
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Cholinergic modulation of dopamine release drives effortful behaviour (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Cholinergic modulation of dopamine release drives effortful behaviour

In the nucleus accumbens, acetylcholine boosts dopamine release to promote effortful behaviour.

  • Gavin C. Touponse
  • Matthew B. Pomrenze
  • Neir Eshel
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Optical control of integer and fractional Chern insulators (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Optical control of integer and fractional Chern insulators

Optical control of integer and fractional Chern insulators is demonstrated by circularly polarized optical pumping in tMoTe2.

  • William Holtzmann
  • Weijie Li
  • Xiaodong Xu
Article28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Environmentally driven immune imprinting protects against allergy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Environmentally driven immune imprinting protects against allergy

In a mouse model, environmental immunostimulation in early life led to cross-reactive adaptive immune memory and reduced type II immune responses to allergens, indicating a mechanistic relationship between environmental antigen exposure and subsequent allergy.

  • S. Erickson
  • B. Lauring
  • R. Medzhitov
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Population-scale sequencing resolves determinants of persistent EBV DNA (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Population-scale sequencing resolves determinants of persistent EBV DNA

Population-scale WGS reveals genetic determinants of persistent EBV DNA, linking immune regulation—especially antigen processing and MHC class II variation—to EBV persistence and heterogeneous disease associations.

  • Sherry S. Nyeo
  • Erin M. Cumming
  • Caleb A. Lareau
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Pesticide residues alter taxonomic and functional biodiversity in soils (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Pesticide residues alter taxonomic and functional biodiversity in soils

A wide survey of pesticide effects on soil biodiversity across 373 sites in Europe reveals that pesticide residues occur in 70% of sites and have major effects on soil biodiversity and functional ecology.

  • J. Köninger
  • M. Labouyrie
  • M. G. A. van der Heijden
Article28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Lasing of a cavity-based X-ray source (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Lasing of a cavity-based X-ray source

Lasing with multi-pass gain is achieved in a diamond-based X-ray cavity at the European XFEL, opening a path to next-generation X-ray science.

  • Patrick Rauer
  • Immo Bahns
  • Harald Sinn
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Bandwidth-tuned Mott transition and superconductivity in moiré WSe2 (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Bandwidth-tuned Mott transition and superconductivity in moiré WSe2

Tunable moiré WSe2 bilayers realize Hubbard-model physics, exhibiting antiferromagnetism, strange metals and superconducting domes, offering a controllable platform to study high-transition-temperature superconductivity.

  • Yiyu Xia
  • Zhongdong Han
  • Jie Shan
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Human and bacterial genetic variation shape oral microbiomes and health (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Human and bacterial genetic variation shape oral microbiomes and health

Human genetic loci that associate with composition of the oral microbiome are identified using saliva-derived DNA, where the same host genetics also shapes oral health and genetic variation in oral bacteria.

  • Nolan Kamitaki
  • Robert E. Handsaker
  • Po-Ru Loh
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: Frequency reproducibility of solid-state thorium-229 nuclear clocks (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Frequency reproducibility of solid-state thorium-229 nuclear clocks

The nuclear clock transition of 229mTh in 229Th:CaF2 crystals is characterized as a function of doping concentration, temperature and time, demonstrating high reproducibility and identifying ideal operating characteristics of these crystals as nuclear clocks.

  • Tian Ooi
  • Jack F. Doyle
  • Thorsten Schumm
Article28 Jan 2026

entry.title: PAF15–PCNA exhaustion governs the strand-specific control of DNA replication (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
PAF15–PCNA exhaustion governs the strand-specific control of DNA replication

PCNA–PAF15 has a key role in determining replisome dynamics during genome replication and protecting against genome instability.

  • Gita Chhetri
  • Sugith Babu Badugu
  • Kumar Somyajit
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026

entry.title: A Cambrian soft-bodied biota after the first Phanerozoic mass extinction (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A Cambrian soft-bodied biota after the first Phanerozoic mass extinction

The Huayuan biota exhibits extraordinary biodiversity, illuminating the impact of the Phanerozoic mass extinction around 513 million years ago and offering critical insights into the transformation of global ecosystems in the early Cambrian.

  • Han Zeng
  • Qi Liu
  • Maoyan Zhu
Article28 Jan 2026

entry.title: An X-ray-emitting protocluster at z ≈ 5.7 reveals rapid structure growth (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An X-ray-emitting protocluster at z ≈ 5.7 reveals rapid structure growth

Discovery of a protocluster at z = 5.68, merely one billion years after the Big Bang, suggests that large-scale structure must have formed more rapidly in some regions of the early universe than previously thought.

  • Ákos Bogdán
  • Gerrit Schellenberger
  • Christopher J. Conselice
ArticleOpen Access28 Jan 2026
